reviewText: Screenwriters for the British-made comedy THE MAGNIFICENT 7 DEADLY SINS include Graham Chapman ("Gluttony" and "Wrath"), Marty Feldman ("Lust") and Spike Milligan ("Sloth"). Chapman was a founding member of MONTY PYTHON'S FLYING CIRCUS, Feldman portrayed hunchbacked Igor in Mel Brooks' YOUNG FRANKENSTEIN (1974) and Spike Milligan was on the pioneering radio program, THE GOON SHOW. (Fellow-Goon Harry Secombe appears in the "Envy" segment.) The large cast also includes one of "The Two Ronnies" and skin mag publisher Bob Guccione. A fine concept, short humorous pieces on the seven Biblical vices is diluted by a total lack of directorial continuity. Each segment has its own style, much to the detriment of all. Fans of Benny Hill's girl-ogling skits as well as those who favor late-60s BBC-TV comedy may find much to like here however. CAST LIST for each "sin"-- "AVARICE"-- Bruce Forsyth/Paul Whitsun-Jones/Bernard Bresslaw/Joan Simms/Roy Hudd/Julie Samuel/Cheryl Hall/Suzanne Heath "ENVY"-- Harry Secombe/Geoffrey Bayldon/June Whitfield/Carmel Cryan "GLUTTONY"-- Leslie Phillips/Julie Ege/Patrick Newell/Rosmarie Reed/Sarah Golding/Bob Guccione/Tina McDowell "LUST"-- Harry H. Corbett/Cheryl Kennedy/Bill Pertwee/Mary Baxter/Anouska Hempel/Kenneth Earle/Nicole Yema/Sue Bond/Yvonne Paul/Dawn Beret "PRIDE"-- Ian Carmichael/Alfie Bass/Audrey Nicholson/Sheila Bernette/Robert Gillespie/Keith Smith/Ivor Dean "SLOTH"-- Harry Secombe/Melvyn Hayes/Ronnie Brody/Ronnie Barker/Peter Butterworth/Marty Feldman/Davy Kaye/David Lodge/Cardew Robinson/Madeline Smith/Graham Stark "WRATH"-- Ronald Fraser/Stephen Lewis/Arthur Howard
